Sentencas: A solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) with an Ni-YSZ anode was tested both without and with porous FeCr disk as a gas diffusion layer (GDL) under direct methane feeding.
Titulo: FeCr gas diffusion layer with surface modification for fuel processing in direct-methane solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The surface of GDL was modified by coating with YSZ or Ni-YSZ powders.
Titulo: FeCr gas diffusion layer with surface modification for fuel processing in direct-methane solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: When gold mesh was used as the current collector, the performance of the direct-methane SOFC degraded very quickly.
Titulo: FeCr gas diffusion layer with surface modification for fuel processing in direct-methane solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: When FeCr GDL was used as the current collector over the anode, the performance became better and stable.
Titulo: FeCr gas diffusion layer with surface modification for fuel processing in direct-methane solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Surface modification of GDL increased the current density.
Titulo: FeCr gas diffusion layer with surface modification for fuel processing in direct-methane solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Both in GDL and over the anode, the major methane reaction was CH(4) dissociation, which yielded C species.
Titulo: FeCr gas diffusion layer with surface modification for fuel processing in direct-methane solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The C species produced in GDL can be removed via gasification by carbon dioxide that forms over the anode.
Titulo: FeCr gas diffusion layer with surface modification for fuel processing in direct-methane solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The formation of CO(2) can become the major reaction in the GDL of FeCr + YSZ while that of CO is the major reaction in the GDL of either FeCr or FeCr + Ni-YSZ.
Titulo: FeCr gas diffusion layer with surface modification for fuel processing in direct-methane solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The electrochemical oxidation of CO formed in GDL increases the current density.
Titulo: FeCr gas diffusion layer with surface modification for fuel processing in direct-methane solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The electrochemical promotion of lattice-oxygen extraction promotes the oxidation of CO and C species over the anode.
Titulo: FeCr gas diffusion layer with surface modification for fuel processing in direct-methane solid oxide fuel cells
